concise_definition: adj. 集体的, 共同的; n. 集体, 联合体

definitions.explanation_en: Belonging to or involving a group of people acting together as a unit, rather than as individuals; characterized by shared ownership, responsibility, or decision-making.
definitions.explanation_cn: 属于或涉及一群人作为整体共同行动，而非个体单独行动；以共同拥有、责任或决策为特征。
definitions.example_en: The artists formed a collective to share studio space and exhibit their work together.
definitions.example_cn: 这些艺术家组成一个联合体，共同分享工作室空间并联合展出作品。

definitions.explanation_en: Relating to or representing the interests of a group as a whole, rather than individual members.
definitions.explanation_cn: 与群体整体的利益相关，而非单个成员的利益。
definitions.example_en: The collective memory of the community shaped its cultural identity.
definitions.example_cn: 社区的集体记忆塑造了其文化认同。

definitions.explanation_en: A group of people who work together in a cooperative or non-hierarchical structure, often sharing resources and responsibilities equally.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一群以合作或非等级结构共同工作的人，通常平等分享资源与责任。
definitions.example_en: The housing collective manages all maintenance and rent payments collectively.
definitions.example_cn: 这个住房联合体共同管理所有维修和租金支付事务。

definitions.explanation_en: A collection or aggregation of things, especially when viewed as a unified whole rather than as separate parts.
definitions.explanation_cn: 事物的集合或总和，尤其当被视为一个统一整体而非独立部分时。
definitions.example_en: The museum displayed a collective of ancient artifacts from across the Mediterranean.
definitions.example_cn: 博物馆展出了来自地中海各地的一批古代文物。

comparison.analysis: “Group”（群体）是一个中性、泛指的词，仅表示若干人或物的聚集，不隐含合作、共享或共同目标。而 “collective” 强调成员之间的协作、共同决策和利益共享，具有更强的社会组织性和意识形态色彩。
“Community”（社区）通常指基于地理、文化或共同利益而自然形成的群体，强调归属感和长期关系。而 “collective” 更侧重于有意识组织起来、为特定目的而联合的结构，可能不依赖地域或血缘，更具行动导向。
“Coalition”（联盟）通常指为实现特定短期目标而临时联合的不同团体或政党，常具有政治性，且成员可能保留独立身份。而 “collective” 更强调持续性、平等性和内部整合，成员身份更紧密，目标更广泛。
